body: Two squatters and a passer-by were injured when a vacated four-story apartment building collapsed early yesterday in the Bushwick section of Brooklyn, fire officials said. Rescue crews had searched the wreckage at 409 Bushwick Avenue for a third squatter, known as Cuba, who several neighbors said was last seen in the building about 6 P.M. Saturday.
title: 3 in Brooklyn Hurt as Building Suddenly Falls

body: International 2-8 Two colonels in the Soviet Union were at the center of attention after Foreign Minister Shevardnadze resigned. He said their right-wing criticism of the Government was the "last straw" in his decision to quit. 1 Soviets yield to U.S. on Pacific islands' status 5 Slovenes voted for independence from Yugoslavia, early results
title: News Summary

body: Two teen-age boys were killed in separate shootings while coming home from parties in Brooklyn early yesterday morning, the police said. In one of the shootings, a gunman killed a 17-year-old boy after stealing his new leather jacket. In the other, the police said, a 14-year-old boy who was found with a large-caliber revolver was fatally shot in
title: TWO TEEN-AGERS SLAIN IN BROOKLYN

body: Maria Rodriguez reigned as matriarch over her seven children and their offspring. Despite financial hardships and a son in jail, the 53-year-old from Puerto Rico managed to keep the family together, her children said. On Sunday evening, Mrs. Rodriguez got out of her car outside her daughter's Brooklyn apartment and was shot and killed as she walked
title: Mother of Seven Killed on Street By Stray Bullet

body: Seven people were killed in New York City in just over seven hours Saturday night and yesterday morning, bringing to a bloody close a week in which the unofficial homicide tally for the year rose above 2,000 for the first time, the police said. Among the victims was a 16-year-old Queens youth who was shot and killed early yesterday by two men who
title: Seven Killings In New York In Seven Hours

body: Nine people were slain in New York City in a 12-hour period Monday night and Tuesday morning, as the city continued to race toward a record number of homicides this year, the police said. The crimes ranged from drive-by shootings by drug dealers to cold-blooded executions on lonely roads. In one case, the police said, an uncle was stabbed to death
title: Killing Continues at Record Pace; 9 Slain in 12 Hours in New York

body: Superintendents of New York City's community school districts said yesterday that the budget cuts proposed on Thursday by Mayor David N. Dinkins would wreak havoc with an already troubled educational system and that the greatest impact would be on the poorest districts. The superintendents were reacting to a memo from Schools Chancellor Joseph A.
title: Dinkins Is Criticized on School Cuts
